content.question: Which of the points lies in Quadrant II of the <math alttext="x y"> <mi>x</mi> <mi>y</mi> </math>-plane?

choices.label: <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math>, because from the positive <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis, <math alttext="pi over 4"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> counterclockwise is in Quadrant II, and the radius is positive.

<math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math>, because from the positive <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis, <math alttext="fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 4 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> clockwise is in Quadrant II, and the radius is positive.

<math alttext="C"><mi>C</mi></math>, because from the positive <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis, <math alttext="fraction numerator 5 pi over denominator 4 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> counterclockwise is in Quadrant III, and the negative radius indicates a reflection over the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis.

<math alttext="D"><mi>D</mi></math>, because from the positive <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis, <math alttext="fraction numerator 7 pi over denominator 4 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> counterclockwise from the origin is in Quadrant IV, and the negative radius indicates the opposite direction of the angle from the origin.

content.answer: <math alttext="D"><mi>D</mi></math>, because from the positive <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis, <math alttext="fraction numerator 7 pi over denominator 4 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> counterclockwise from the origin is in Quadrant IV, and the negative radius indicates the opposite direction of the angle from the origin.
